title: Wife who 'plotted to kill rich husband sent lover violent messages before 'murder'
text:

A wife sent her lover violent messages before plotting with him to murder her wealthy husband, a court heard.

Angela Taylor, 53, is accused of conspiring with Paul Cannon, 54, to kill William "Bill" Taylor after nearly 25 years of marriage.

But the mum today dismissed their graphic and sexual messages as "meaningless".

St Albans Crown Court heard Cannon wrote on WhatsApp: "You know what I'd like to do ... make love to you on his kitchen table ... with him tied to a chair so he had to watch!!!!!!! Then send him to hell."

Taylor replied: "Think that would kill him, last thing he saw was us making love."

A message from Cannon said he planned to "torture the c****... nail their feet to the scaffolding", though it was not specified who this was about.

(Image: south bedsnews agency_sbna_fairl)

Taylor said the hundreds of texts were "rubbish chat" used to vent about people in her and Cannon's lives.

Jurors were also told of a message sent by Taylor where she said she wanted to "get shot" of Mr Taylor.

She told the court: "It was just a phrase you say when you want to get someone out of your life, I don't mean actually shooting someone."

In other messages heard in court, Cannon said he would "sort out Bill first, frighten the life out of him" weeks before his disappearance.

"Good," Taylor replied at the time.

Jennifer Dempster QC, defending Taylor, later asked: "What was your motivation of you exchanging these extreme messages with Paul Cannon?"

"I don't really know," Taylor replied.

(Image: south bedsnews agency_sbna_fairl)

(Image: south bedsnews agency_sbna_fairl)

"We got to drink, I was drinking quite a lot and he was sending me texts and I was sending them back. They were quite meaningless messages.

"It was just talk that we had cooked up to vent."

Mr Taylor, a 69-year-old wealthy farmer was last seen on June 3 last year at his home, Harkness Hall in Gosmore, Hertfordshire.

His body was found eight months later in a river by a passing fisherman.

But Taylor and Cannon both deny murder, arson and an alternative charge of conspiracy to murder.

(Image: south bedsnews agency_sbna_fairl)

Taylor began dating Cannon in 2016 but did not tell anyone or think the relationship was going to last long term.

"I didn't want anyone to know, I didn't want to hurt the kids, I didn't want to hurt Bill," she said.

Taylor, from Hitchin, Hertfordshire, said she regularly deleted the WhatsApp messages so her daughter would not see them, meaning that she was not aware of the full conversations.

She added she was "embarrassed and ashamed" to read them all in court.

The case continues.
description: Angela Taylor, of Hitchin, Hertfordshire, allegedly worked with Paul Cannon to kill her husband William "Bill" Taylor whose body was found in a river
